title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 352.19 - Expenses incident to employment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 352.19 - Expenses incident to employment

State Regulations

The following expenses incident to employment shall be
deducted from gross monthly earnings: (a) $150 of earned income for each individual
engaged in employment must be disregarded after applying the earned income
disregard percentage to the gross income. (b) Expenses incident to employment shall not
be deducted from gross earnings in any month where the individual: (1)
terminated his or her employment or
reduced his or her earnings without good cause within the period of 30 days
preceding such month; (2)
refused
without good cause, within a period of 30 days preceding such month, to accept
employment in which he or she is able to engage, offered by the State

Employment Service, or any other bona fide offer of employment; or
(3)
failed without good cause to make a
timely report of new or increased income. A report of income is considered
timely if a recipient reports the receipt of new or increased income no later
than 10 days after the receipt of the income. A report of such income made more
than 10 days after receipt is not timely, but a report made more than 10 days
prior to the end of the month is timely with respect to the next month and any
succeeding month. Notes

York State Register May 10, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 19, eff. 5/10/2023

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
